# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `h_hypertension`
* Variable label: `History of Hypertension`
* Variable description: `history of hypertension or high blood pressure`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | NOT High blood pressure or hypertension 
1        | High blood pressure or hypertension

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

* Short name: `h_hypertension_age`
* Variable label: `Age first diagnosed hypertension`
* Variable description: `The age first told had hypertension diagnosis`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `Continuous`
* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

<!-- # Global variables -->
```{r global, include=FALSE, echo=F}
miss_values_vector <- c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999)
ds_label <- "History of Hypertension"
ds_label_age <- "Age first diagnosed hypertension"
cat_label <- c("No" = 0, "Yes" = 1, "Missing" = 999, "Do not know" = 998, "Refuse" = 997, "Not applicable" = 996, "Does not answer" = 995, "Not attempt not done" = 994, "Disable to measure" = 993, "Impute" = 992, "CAPI interviewer error" = 991)
cont_label <- cat_label[3:11]
datafolder <- "../RData/"
#sing_idlist <- c()
```

# Data process



## Greece


### Wave 1


#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `HTN` |
|-|-|
| **Label** | `Hypertension at baseline`|
| **Table name**  | `ATTICA_Baseline`|
| **Categories** | `0 = Normal`<br/>`1 = Hypertensive` |
| **Missings** | `NA` |
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'ATTICA_w1','ATTICA.ATTICA_Baseline',variables=list('HTN'), missings = T)
ATTICA_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'ATTICA_w1')

```

```{r local w1, echo=F}

vbl <- ATTICA_w1$HTN
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(ATTICA_w1)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(ATTICA_w1, aes(x=factor(HTN))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`

Age of diagnosis cannot be harmonized.

**R script:**

```{r harmo w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
ATTICA_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=ATTICA_w1$id)
ATTICA_ds_w1$h_hypertension <- car::recode(ATTICA_w1$HTN,"NA=999")

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript w1, echo=F}

vbl <- ATTICA_ds_w1$h_hypertension
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(ATTICA_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(h_hypertension))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `HTN == 0 and HTN5 == 0 into 0`
* `HTN == 1 or HTN5 == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_hypertension_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_hypertension == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, h_hypertension_age = age-(year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2`
* `if h_hypertension == 0, h_hypertension_age = 996`
* `h_hypertension == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w2}

ATTICA_w2 <- left_join(ATTICA_w2, ATTICA_w1, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
ATTICA_ds_w2 <- tibble(id=ATTICA_w2$id)
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension <- rep(999,length(ATTICA_w2$id))
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension[which(ATTICA_w2$HTN5 == 0 & ((!is.na(ATTICA_w2$HTN)) & ATTICA_w2$HTN != 1))] <- 0
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension[which(ATTICA_w2$HTN5 == 1 | ((!is.na(ATTICA_w2$HTN5)) & ATTICA_w2$HTN == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
diabetes_age <- ATTICA_w2$age[which(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension == 1 & ATTICA_w2$HTN==0)]-(ATTICA_w2$yintw_w2[which(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension == 1 & ATTICA_w2$HTN==0)]-ATTICA_w2$yintw_w1[which(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension == 1 & ATTICA_w2$HTN==0)])/2

ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension_age <- rep(999,length(ATTICA_w2$id))
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension == 0)] <- 996
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension == 1 & ATTICA_w2$HTN==0)] <- diabetes_age

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `HTN == 0 and HTN5 == 0 and HTN10 == 0 into 0`
* `HTN == 1 or HTN5 == 1 or HTN10 == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_hypertension_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_hypertension == 1 in w3 and 0 in w2, h_hypertension_age = age-(year of interview w3-year of interview w2)/2`
* `if h_hypertension == 1 in w3 and w2, h_hypertension_age as in w2`
* `if h_hypertension == 0, h_hypertension_age = 996`
* `h_hypertension == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w3}

# We use the harmonized variable of wave 2 instead of the study-specific variables from all the previous waves
ATTICA_w3 <- left_join(ATTICA_w3, ATTICA_ds_w2, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
ATTICA_ds_w3 <- tibble(id=ATTICA_w3$id)
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension <- rep(999,length(ATTICA_w3$id))
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension[which(ATTICA_w3$HTN10 == 0 & ((is.na(ATTICA_w3$h_hypertension)) | ATTICA_w3$h_hypertension != 1))] <- 0
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension[which(ATTICA_w3$HTN10 == 1 | ((!is.na(ATTICA_w3$HTN10)) & ATTICA_w3$h_hypertension == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
diabetes_age <- ATTICA_w3$age[which(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_hypertension==0)]-(ATTICA_w3$yintw_w3[which(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_hypertension==0)]-ATTICA_w3$yintw_w2[which(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_hypertension==0)])/2

ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension_age <- rep(999,length(ATTICA_w3$id))
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension_age[which(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension == 0)] <- 996
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension_age[which(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_hypertension==0)] <- diabetes_age
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension_age[which(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_hypertension==1)] <- car::recode(ATTICA_w3$h_hypertension_age[which(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_hypertension==1)],"miss_values_vector=999")

```

## Summary of descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Two tables are generated: 

1. Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable.

2. Frequencies and percentages of individuals with different trajectories. To avoid too large table, Only trajectories with percentages larger than 0.3 are shown.

**R script:**

```{r summ}
ATTICA_ds_w1$h_hypertension <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w1$h_hypertension, labels = cat_label)
label(ATTICA_ds_w1$h_hypertension) <- ds_label
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension, labels = cat_label)
label(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension) <- ds_label
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension_age <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension_age, labels = cont_label)
label(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension_age) <- ds_label_age
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension, labels = cat_label)
label(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension) <- ds_label
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension_age <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension_age, labels = cont_label)
label(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension_age) <- ds_label_age


ATTICA_m_ds_w1 <- ATTICA_ds_w1
ATTICA_m_ds_w1$h_hypertension <- car::recode(ATTICA_m_ds_w1$h_hypertension, "miss_values_vector=NA")
ATTICA_m_ds_w2 <- ATTICA_ds_w2
ATTICA_m_ds_w2$h_hypertension <- car::recode(ATTICA_m_ds_w2$h_hypertension, "miss_values_vector=NA")
ATTICA_m_ds_w3 <- ATTICA_ds_w3
ATTICA_m_ds_w3$h_hypertension <- car::recode(ATTICA_m_ds_w3$h_hypertension, "miss_values_vector=NA")


tt <-    frq(ATTICA_ds_w1$h_hypertension)[[1]][,c(1:2,4)]
tt[4] <- frq(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension)[[1]][,c(4)]
tt[5] <- frq(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension)[[1]][,c(4)]
tt[13,] <- c("n", "sample size", 
             length(ATTICA_ds_w1$h_hypertension), length(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_hypertension), length(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_hypertension)
             )
names(tt)<-c("val", "label", "w1", "w2", "w3")
kable(tt)

dbb <- merge(ATTICA_m_ds_w1[,c("id","h_hypertension")], ATTICA_m_ds_w2[,c("id","h_hypertension")], by="id", suffixes = c(".w1",".w2"), all=T)
dbb <- merge(dbb, ATTICA_m_ds_w3[,c("id","h_hypertension")], by="id", all=T)
names(dbb) <- c("id", "w1", "w2", "w3")
v.dbb <- paste(dbb[,2],dbb[,3],dbb[,4],sep="")
f.dbb <- frq(v.dbb)[[1]][,c(1,2,4)]
kable(f.dbb[f.dbb[,3]>=0.3,])
```



# Quality estimation

We assume that if an individual answers it has diabetes in one wave, it has diabetes for all the next waves. Individuals with discrepancies with respect to this criterium are specified at the end of each validation.
